ygData.messageBody:
Hi!

> Now that would be a big exploit. Its the client who tells you if you
> can or cannot hit a mob so it might be possible to change the mobs position in client side
> only... like make them all appear just in your face (sure, only the ones you know the ID)..
> done that you can cast / hit them from far away...

No, distance is checked on both client and server. Each of them can
cancel attack. For example, client can allow you casting (you begin to
cast a spell) but with some lag "target is out of range" will come from
server and your casting aborted. So i believe no distance cheat is
possible. And if even it will be possible, it will be easy for Verant to
stop it by adding simple check. BTW, monster's attacks also checked for
distance in AI, but only by XY coords, and player's attacks checked by
XYZ (and maybe Z check is client side only!). So it is possible when
monsters attack you from far above or below, and you cannot strike back.

> I dont know if EQ have the mechanics (however its spelled) to avoid this kind of cheat...
> they could send sanity checks asking/sending to the clients lots of stuff to avoid this kind
> of cheat but that would increase lag. Seems to me that Verant relies all their protection
> (against this kind of cheat) in dont allowing you to ALT-TAB, which is a good protection
> but not the best... if you have anything running between you and the server as I mentioned
> before you really dont need to ALT-TAB. you can create your own commands that only
> your program understand and do not send to the server... lemme see what could be done
> easily...

Server do not have any checks for "too fast movement" or "instant
teleportation". There are some "warp holes" exists in several zones. You
walk to some spot and become teleported. It is bug, but when it happens,
server do not make any actions to stop it. Some guys use it as zone
border usually used, or as "guaranteed" shadow step. So instant
teleportation isnt checked and can be cheated with. But Verant can add
checking. But it will be not easy - "shadow steps" and "sow" spells make
it difficult.

And targeting through wall cannot be checked by server at all. Tracing
is too proccessor consuming, and one server works for over 1000 people.

> /ultravision on/off
> /rain start/stop
> /sow on/off -> As someone mentioned before maybe the server dont
> have sanity checks
> to see if you are moving too fast... the server might trust the client
> too much in this aspect of the game
> /levitate on/off
> /clipping on/off -> it would allow you to move through walls just like
> quake

Yeah, it will be cool :)

> /breath on/off -> would let you breath underwater... did you
> EVER notice that the air indicator is NEVER
> affected by lag ? Maybe the server trust the client too much in
> this....

No, i think client knows you are in water and approximate your
breathing. It works in same way as health bar - client try to approx it,
but really only server can change it. BTW, about water: on client,
monsters seems to move in water slow (as players), and on server, they
move much faster (almost at land run speed). Seems like Verant made
monsters swim faster, but patched only server, without client :)

> again, Verant rely most of their security dont allowing you to
> ALT-TAB, and they trust too much in EQ client =P
> BUT I can be completely wrong anyway =)

You do not need to hack EQ program to cheat, you can hack network
protocol. All vital data flow through protocol and it is much easer to
decode than program itself. But protocol can be crypted, and impossible
to decode at all..

> I just think the game is too fun and no one is bored enough to start
> coding

I agree. If you will start cracking EQ, your friends will gain several
levels and it will be impossible to group with them anymore :)
